data.title: Meet The Fockers cast now – accidental death, cancer scare and cloned dog
data.meta_description: Cult comedy Meet The Fockers was a box office hit, grossing $522million worldwide with its star-studded cast. But where are these famous faces now? Let’s take a closer look...
data.text:
In 2004 Meet the Fockers had us captivated as Jack Byrnes encountered the quirky characters of Rozalin and Bernie Focker.

The smash hit movie was the sequel to the 2000 film Meet the Parents and the premiere of the film brought together Hollywood icons like Robert De Niro and Ben Stiller.

The film was a box office hit, grossing $522million (£410m) worldwide. It was followed by a sequel, Little Fockers, in 2010.

As we reminisce about this comedic gem, we’re all wondering where the cast members are now.

READ MORE: Elvis Presley’s grisly autopsy – constipated for months and covered in sores

From serious health scares, a suicide attempt and Me Too allegations, these stars have been very busy since appearing in the cult comedy hit, and many are calling for a fourth instalment.

Ben Stiller

In a previous interview, Ben opened up about a scary health battle he dealt with years after the Meet the Fockers hit theatres.

In October 2016, the actor revealed he was previously diagnosed with prostate cancer.

“It came out of the blue for me. I had no idea,” Ben said on The Howard Stern Show. “At first, I didn’t know what was gonna happen.

"I was scared. It just stopped everything in your life because you can’t plan for a movie because you don’t know what’s gonna happen.”

Ben ultimately looked to one of his Meet the Fockers co-stars for some advice.

“The first thing I did when I got diagnosed was get on the internet to try to learn. I saw Robert had had it. I called him right away,” the father-of-two continued.

Fortunately today, Ben is cancer-free.

After Meet the Fockers, Ben earned acting credits in the Night at the Museum franchise, Little Fockers, the Madagascar movies, Arrested Development, The Secret Life of Walter Mitty and the Zoolander franchise.

Robert De Niro

The A-list actor has continued his successful acting career since Meet the Fockers with roles in Little Fockers, New Year's Eve, Silver Linings Playbook, The Big Wedding, The Intern and Dirty Grandpa.

But the star recently faced a very personal tragedy when his grandson Leandro De Niro Rodriguez, 19, was found dead in July this year.

The New York City Medical Examiner’s Office said his death was the result of a toxic combination of fentanyl, bromazolam, alprazolam, 7-aminoclonazepam, ketamine, and cocaine.

His death has been ruled an accident.

The Oscar winner has also been the victim of a terrifying burglary after a serial burglar was caught red-handed rifling through Robert De Niro’s rented Manhattan townhouse last year.

The robber was found fumbling around with his iPad and looking at his the Christmas gifts under his tree.

“She was stealing Christmas presents,” a police official said at the time.

Teri Polo

The actress went onto appear in a slew of hits including The West Wing, CSI: Miami, The Hole, Law & Order: Special Victims Unit and comedy show Curb Your Enthusiasm.

Most notably she starred as Stef Foster in the TV series The Fosters.

Unfortunately the star has struggled in her personal life.

In April 1997, Polo married photographer Anthony Moore, and they welcomed a son named Griffin in 2002.

However, their marriage ended in divorce in 2003.

Subsequently, in 2006, while working on a video set, she crossed paths with drummer Jamie Wollam.

They became a couple and had a daughter named Bayley in 2007.

Unfortunately, their relationship eventually came to an end in 2012.

Blyth Danner

Since Meet the Fockers, Gwyneth Paltrow's gorgeous mum has landed roles in Will & Grace, Huff, The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2 and Little Fockers.

The star recently shared with People that she is "lucky to be alive" after being diagnosed with adenoid cystic carcinoma.

"It's a sneaky disease," Danner said. "But I'm fine and dandy now."

Danner said she "felt a lump" in her neck in 2018 while working in London.

"I started feeling very woozy and I was forgetting everything," said Danner, who pointed out that the lump was also found in the same place her husband, director and screenwriter Bruce Paltrow, had found his in 1999.

He died in 2002 due to complications from oral cancer and pneumonia.

In 2005, she filmed a public service announcement to raise public awareness of the disease and the need for early detection.

Danner has also been involved in environmental issues such as recycling and conservation.

Barbara Streisand

Have you joined Threads? Follow Daily Star to keep up to date on all things showbiz here

Barbra is more well known for her successful music career opposed to acting, however, she has appeared in Little Fockers, The Guilt Trip and in an episode of Modern Family since 2004.

Her accolades include two Academy Awards, 10 Grammy Awards, five Emmy Awards, and nine Golden Globes.

Streisand has been happily married to actor James Brolin since 1998 and is the owner of multiple dogs.

In fact, she loved her dog Samantha so much, that she had her cloned.

The star is also very committed to philanthropy and, in September 2022, she was invited by Ukrainian President Zelenskyy to become an ambassador for the UNITED24 platform, focusing on the Medical Aid direction of support.

Streisand helped raise $240,000 (£188k) for medical care.

Streisand has personally raised $25million (£19.6m) for organisations through her live performances.

Dustin Hoffman

The iconic actor has continued his successful career with credits including The Lost City, the Kung Fu Panda franchise, Luck, and The Choir.

In 2017, actor Dustin Hoffman faced accusations of sexual misconduct or assault from seven women.

One woman, who was 17 years old at the time, alleged that while interning on a TV production of Death of a Salesman, Hoffman engaged in inappropriate behavior, including making suggestive comments and requesting foot massages.

Hoffman issued an apology to the intern, expressing regret for potentially making her uncomfortable and emphasising his respect for women, though he denied any wrongdoing.

Additionally, it was reported that Meryl Streep claimed Hoffman groped her breast during their initial meeting, but a representative for Streep clarified that the incident was not accurately portrayed and that Hoffman had apologised for it, an apology Streep accepted.

Owen Wilson

With an estimated $70million (£55m) in total wealth, the actor became a household name with appearances in major high-profile movies such as his starring roles in the Cars franchise and Wonder and appearing as Loki on Disney+.

But his success was marred by some serious personal struggles.

In August 2007, Wilson made headlines when he attempted suicide and subsequently sought treatment for depression at St John's Health Center and Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles.

Following his hospitalisation, Wilson withdrew from his role in the film Tropic Thunder, produced by his friend Ben Stiller, and was replaced by Matthew McConaughey.

Wilson decided to open up about his suicide attempt in an article with Esquire in 2021 and revealed how his older brother, Andrew, played a vital role in supporting him through his recovery.

In January 2011, Wilson had a son with his then-girlfriend Jade Duell, though their relationship ended later that year.

He went on to have two more children with two different partners.
